definition: martyr of the revolution
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements
surname Shi
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: A monument was built in dedication to the memory of revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 为纪念革命烈士建造了一座纪念碑。

sentences.english: We paid a visit to the monument to the revolutionary martyrs with great respect.
sentences.chinese: 我们怀着崇敬的心情瞻仰了革命烈士纪念碑。

sentences.english: Within days, local officials had designated the dead official a "revolutionary martyr."
sentences.chinese: 几天后，当地官员就授予已故官员“革命烈士”称号。

sentences.english: We set up a monument to the memory of the revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 我们建立了一座革命烈士纪念碑。

sentences.english: The names of the revolutionary martyrs were inscribed on a monument.
sentences.chinese: 革命烈士的名字刻在纪念碑上。

sentences.english: Eg: Wang Wei was dubbed revolutionary martyr.
sentences.chinese: 王伟被授予“革命烈士”称号。

sentences.english: The monument was erected in honor of the revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 纪念碑是为了纪念革命烈士而建的。

sentences.english: They will not abandon the demand for retribution for the blood of the revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 他们不会放弃为革命烈士们血债血偿的要求。

sentences.english: I went to the Babaoshan Revolutionary Cemetery to pay my respect to those revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 我去了八宝山革命公墓，祭奠那些革命烈士。

sentences.english: They paid their respects to the revolutionary martyrs.
People inscribed a monument with the names of the revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 人们把革命烈士的名字刻在纪念碑上。

definition: martyr
martyr to the revolution
to heroically sacrifice one's life
martyr
national hero
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
the seventy two martyrs of the Huanghuagang uprising of 23rd April 1911
pinyin: Huang2 hua1 gang1 qi1 shi2 er4 lie4 shi4

definition: Communist Party member
monument
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
memorial hall/commemorative museum
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Song Renqiong (1909-2005), general of the People's Liberation Army
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
(China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
